name: Project Hail Mary
shortDescription: A lone astronaut must save humanity from an extinction-level threat while dealing with memory loss and being millions of miles from Earth.
bookContent: From the author of The Martian comes a thrilling tale of survival and discovery, as Ryland Grace awakens alone on a spacecraft with no memory of his mission or even his own name.

name: Neuromancer
shortDescription: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel following a washed-up hacker hired for one last job that could change the face of the digital world.
bookContent: The novel that defined cyberpunk, Neuromancer explores a future where technology has transformed society, and the line between reality and virtual reality becomes increasingly blurred.

name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
shortDescription: An aging Hollywood starlet finally tells her life story to an unknown journalist, revealing shocking truths about her seven marriages.
bookContent: A mesmerizing novel about the price of fame, ambition, and identity in Golden Age Hollywood, told through the memorable voice of fictional movie icon Evelyn Hugo.

name: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
shortDescription: A complex story about friendship, love, and creativity following two friends who collaborate on video game development over three decades.
bookContent: Spanning thirty years, this novel explores the multifaceted relationship between Sam and Sadie as they create worlds, face tragedies, and navigate their complex relationship.

name: SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome
shortDescription: A comprehensive examination of Roman civilization from its founding myths through the Republic and early Empire.
bookContent: Mary Beard narrates the first thousand years of Roman history, challenging our preconceptions and exploring how Rome grew from an insignificant village to the center of a vast empire.

name: The Guns of August
shortDescription: A detailed account of the first month of World War I, examining the decisions and events that led to global conflict.
bookContent: This Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece chronicles the fateful first month of World War I, when decisions made by heads of state cascaded into a conflict that would reshape the world.

name: Gone Girl
shortDescription: A woman disappears on her wedding anniversary, leaving her husband as the prime suspect in a twisted tale of psychological manipulation.
bookContent: This masterful psychological thriller explores marriage, media, and the depths of human deception through the lens of Nick and Amy Dunne's complicated relationship.

name: The Silent Patient
shortDescription: A woman shoots her husband five times and never speaks again, becoming the focus of a criminal psychotherapist determined to uncover her motive.
bookContent: This psychological thriller follows criminal psychotherapist Theo Faber's dangerous obsession with understanding why Alicia Berenson murdered her husband and then fell silent.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
shortDescription: A journalist and a brilliant hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance, uncovering dark secrets about one of Sweden's wealthiest families.
bookContent: This international bestseller combines murder mystery, family saga, and financial intrigue into one satisfyingly complex story featuring the unforgettable character Lisbeth Salander.

name: Dune
shortDescription: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, this epic science fiction novel follows Paul Atreides as his family accepts control of the most valuable substance in the universe.
bookContent: Winner of multiple awards, this masterpiece of science fiction combines politics, religion, and ecology in a complex tale of destiny, power, and human evolution.

name: The Waste Land
shortDescription: A masterpiece of modernist poetry exploring themes of post-war disillusionment, cultural decay, and spiritual crisis.
bookContent: Published in 1922, this groundbreaking poem revolutionized modern poetry with its fragmented narrative style, multiple voices, and rich literary allusions spanning various cultures and traditions.

name: Steve Jobs
shortDescription: The official biography of Apple's co-founder, based on more than forty interviews with Jobs himself.
bookContent: Based on more than forty interviews conducted over two years, this biography tells the story of the roller-coaster life and intense personality of a creative entrepreneur whose passion for perfection revolutionized six industries.

name: The Name of the Wind
shortDescription: The intimate narrative of Kvothe, an adventurer and musician, as he recounts his transformation into the most notorious wizard his world has ever seen.
bookContent: The first day of the Kingkiller Chronicle tells the story of a young man who grows to become a legend, exploring magic, music, love, and the price of power.

name: The Republic
shortDescription: Plato's masterwork on justice, governance, and the nature of the ideal state, written as a dialogue between Socrates and various Athenians.
bookContent: One of the most influential works of philosophy in history, examining justice, the role of the philosopher in society, and the nature of the ideal state through Socratic dialogue.

name: Death of a Salesman
shortDescription: A tragic play following traveling salesman Willy Loman as he grapples with the American Dream and his perceived failure in life.
bookContent: This Pulitzer Prize-winning play examines the cost of blind faith in the American Dream and the tragic consequences of a life spent pursuing material success.

name: Leaves of Grass
shortDescription: A groundbreaking collection of poetry celebrating the American experience, democracy, nature, love, and friendship.
bookContent: First published in 1855 and continuously revised until the author's death, this collection revolutionized American poetry with its free verse style and celebration of the individual.

name: The Mistborn Trilogy
shortDescription: In a world where ash falls from the sky and evil lords rule through magical and political power, a street thief discovers she has the power to change everything.
bookContent: This epic fantasy series combines intricate magic systems, political intrigue, and heist storylines in a world where the dark lord won and a new hero must rise from the ashes.

name: Beyond Good and Evil
shortDescription: A philosophical work that expands the ideas of Nietzsche's previous work, questioning traditional morality and proposing new values.
bookContent: Published in 1886, this foundational text challenges traditional morality and philosophical assumptions, proposing a new approach to understanding human values and culture.

name: Long Walk to Freedom
shortDescription: The autobiography of Nelson Mandela, chronicling his life from his rural village through his triumph over apartheid.
bookContent: This powerful autobiography tells the story of one of the world's most inspiring moral leaders, from his early life through his 27 years in prison to his role in healing a nation.

name: A Streetcar Named Desire
shortDescription: A play depicting the mental and emotional deterioration of Blanche DuBois when she moves in with her sister in New Orleans.
bookContent: This Pulitzer Prize-winning play explores themes of desire, delusion, and the decline of Southern aristocracy through the conflict between Blanche DuBois and Stanley Kowalski.
